alert.note: Alert for Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Middlesex; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:02PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, northeastern New Kent and southeastern King William Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Little Plymouth, or near West Point, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Shacklefords around 420 PM EDT. Church View around 430 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Mattaponi, Eltham, Warner, Mascot, Velma, Romancoke, Plum Point, Gressit and Clancie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Middlesex; New Kent
